title: Po odeslání zprávy se objevují hlášky, co je špatně?
content: Dobrý den. Win 7, Thunderbird (THB) verse 78.14.0 ( 32bitů). Stav po úplné reinstalaci OS a přenesení THB ze starého OS. Přijímat a odesílat jde ale objevují se hlášky. Všechny požadavky hlášek byly splněny: filtry žádně nastavené nejsou, místa na disku je dost, přesto se odeslaná zpráva uloží do Místní složky. Dá se s tím žít ale rád bych to uvedl do stavu před reinstalací OS. Mám dvě adresy: @seznam - na této je to v pohodě a @quick - jenom na této adrese jsou tyhle hlášky. S pozdravem Bareš
creator: lubombar

title: Caldav sync to Axigen Tasks and Calendar
content:
Hi,

We use Thunderbird in our office and have an Axigen mail server which has worked great for the past 6 years.

Our users all want to use the Calendars and Tasks and have them sync both ways with TB.

This is proving more difficult than it appears.

How do we setup the Tasks to sync both ways?

It reads from AX but will not sync back? Is there an extension for the Tasks which needs to be installed?

There is only and option for adding Calendars. No option to add Tasks?

Thanks for a great product and thanks in advance for your help.

Kevin
creator: kevin206

title: Thunderbird (102.9.1) freezes after compacting inbox folder!!
content:
Hi! I am using Thunderbird in my PC since 2018. I have 3 accounts connected to it, a Yahoo account, a Hotmail and a Gmail one.

I am mostly using Hotmail. Yesterday, I marked an E-Mail message as spam. Then, Thunderbird asked me to Compact now the inbox and I selected Yes. The compacting finished but since then, Thunderbird freezes and says Not Responding when I select e-mail messages in inbox folder to view them.

My hotmail's inbox has 24911 messages and 9.1GB disk size.

The other accounts (Yahoo, Gmail) are working fine.

What happened?

What should I do now?

It is a kind of urgent, I cannot work!

Thank you.
creator: GeorgeGR

title: Acces to old mails
content:
Hi

Someone please help.

I was running Thunderbird ver. 38.x.x on my Win 7 PC. All was good and never had any problems.

Recently I made the mistake to update to latest ver. 102.x.x.

This caused several issues and was not really what I was expecting. Therefore I decided to go back again.

Now I am running ver. 52.9.1. which is more or less like ver. 38. However I have one issue.

I have several IMAP mails accounts. 2 of these mail accounts are from an old mail server provider which is no longer in use. However I had access to all these older mails, which are located on my PC.

Since I did the upgrade and came back down I can no access thes older mails. When I open the account inbox, Thunderbird tries to connect to the mail server, which no longer exists.

How can I have Thunderbird to open these mails, which I assume are still located on my PC?

PS: I have even tried to install ver. 38, (same issue)

Thanks for help. :-)

ftlx
creator: ftlx

title: Sending and receiving emails in Thunderbird works only once or twice a day
content: The two email accounts in the house were unable to send or receive email in Thunderbird last Friday. Mail was still received on the server. The next day the gates were opened, and sending and receiving was no problem, for several hours. We have been closed off and allowed back on once or twice a day since then. The error message we get when sending is that the SMTP settings are incorrect. Without changing the settings, the email sending and receiving has been going on and off. What shall we do? I am sending this message to our small independent server, also.
creator: carpelesi

title: Thunderbird issues an error message and incoming emails have stopped.
content:
Message: Error with account abc@def.com. Sending of user name did not succeed. Mail server pop.def.com responded [AUTH] Plain text authentication disallowed on non-secure (SSl/TLS) connections.

The above suggests the problem is with an outgoing message. The real issue is that incoming messages forwarded from the host of my email address have been stopped from 8.00am this morning. It is now 11.34pm here in Australia as I write.

Have never received the above message before. The incoming email forwarding arrangement has been stable for many years.

Will appreciate a solution to this issue.

title: Email text formatting problem
content:
Hello,

I am in the process of switching from Outlook the Thunderbird, and I have run into a frustrating issue with text formatting in emails that I cannot seem to resolve. I have attached three examples to illustrate the problem.

When composing emails, Thunderbird is showing me the correct font sizing that I am trying to achieve. The body text is correct, along with the signature block. However, when I send the email (to another account that I also have setup in Thunderbird) the text size on the receiving end when viewed in Thunderbird is much larger. When I open the copy saved by Thunderbird in the sent mail folder of the outgoing account, it too displays the text at the same much larger size.

How do I fix this such that the email when received appears as I see in when composing it? Note that this issue does not seem to manifest itself in incoming emails I receive from outside of Thunderbird (i.e., they retain their intended formatting).

title: Thunderbird deleted messages from Inbox
content:
I use Comcast/Xfinity for my ISP...Thunderbird as my service. Over the last month or so, regular emails from trusted contacts in my address book aren't arriving in my Inbox. Some do, some don't. I check the T-bird Activity Manager and for example, a red X indicates, "Deleted 4 messages from Inbox". Just today over 20 messages were deleted by noon. I cannot see what's being deleted nor the sender. Nothing in Junk, nothing in Drafts, nothing in Templates. The messages just disappear.

My clients send messages and file attachments all day, every day, and emails are critical for my operation.

I'm not aware that I've changed any settings in either Comcast or T-bird. What may be the issue? thanks!

title: Why can't I change the "Start Time" and "Due Date" on a new task?!?
content:
Hey all -

This is an issue I've had for awhile now, mostly pertaining to Calendar events, but today I noticed it happening on the creation of a new task, as well: I cannot change the "Start Time" or "Due Date" of a task upon clicking the "New Task" button. It assumes that I want the task set at the next hour, and try as I might, I will try to set it to the time I WANT to set it to, and it just... does not care. The time stays as the time it listed.

I've had this issue on Calendar events, as well, and... it's... extremely frustrating. I don't know if I'm doing something wrong or if this is just some wild bug, but I want it work. :(

My setup:

  • Operating System: Fedora 36
  • Thunderbird Version: 102.8.0
